1.text: Brush when your hair is dry to avoid breakage.

2.text: Avoid over-brushing your hair to keep it healthy.

3.text: Spritz some hairspray on your brush to avoid creating static.

4.text: Finish with a few brushes from roots to tips for extra shine.

5.text: Work in a detangler, leave-in conditioner, or hair oil to loosen up tangles.

6.text: Comb the bottom 2 to 3 in (5.1 to 7.6 cm) of your hair.

7.text: Brush or comb at tangles with light, gentle strokes.

8.text: Pick a brush made with quality materials.

9.text: Choose a boar bristle brush for most hair types.

10.text: Use a mixed-bristle brush for medium-thick hair.

11.text: Go for a brush with sparse nylon bristles if you have thick, coarse hair.

12.text: Look for flexible bristles and a curved body if your hair is curly.

13.text: Use a plastic vented brush for brushing and styling short hair.

14.text: Clean your brush once every 2 weeks to remove product buildup.

15.text: Mix up a bowl of shampoo and water to create a little bubble bath.

16.text: Let the brush soak in it for 3-4 minutes.

17.text: Rinse the brush and remove hairs with the tail of a comb.

18.text: Let your brush dry upside-down on a towel.
